system-characteristics.description: [A detailed description of the system, its purpose, and the industrial process it supports.]

information-types.title: Industrial Process Control Data
information-types.description: Real-time and historical data related to the industrial process, including sensor readings, actuator commands, and operational setpoints.

authorization-boundary.description: The authorization boundary includes the Ansible Automation Platform application, the underlying Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 operating systems, and the network infrastructure they reside on. The boundary extends to the managed nodes and the integrated identity provider.

system-implementation.description: This SSP describes the implementation of ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 SL-4 controls for the [System Name]. The system is composed of Ansible Automation Platform (AAP) running on Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 9 hosts.

components.title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9
components.description: The underlying operating system for all AAP nodes.

components.title: Organizational Procedures
components.description: Security controls implemented through documented organizational policies and procedures.

components.title: Supporting Infrastructure
components.description: Security controls implemented by the physical hardware, data center facilities, and external services.

implemented-requirements.description: Human user authentication to AAP is enforced through integration with [Identity Provider Name, e.g., Microsoft Entra ID] via SAML. System administrators and operators must authenticate with their corporate credentials.
Multi-factor authentication is enforced by a policy named '[MFA Policy Name]' in the integrated identity provider. All users in the '[AAP User Group Name]' are required to use an MFA token to log in.

The underlying RHEL 9 hosts are configured in FIPS 140-2 mode. This is enforced by the Ansible playbook which runs 'fips-mode-setup --enable'. All cryptographic modules used by the OS and AAP meet this standard.

The RHEL 9 hosts are hardened to a principle of least functionality using the 'rhel9_iac_for_62443' Ansible playbook. This includes removing unnecessary packages such as 'cockpit' and disabling unused services.

This control is a compensating control. The physical servers hosting the AAP environment are located in the [Data Center Name and Room Number] data center. The facility provides physical tamper resistance and detection through locked server cages, 24/7 video surveillance, and biometric access controls as detailed in the [Data Center Security Policy Document Name].
